snippet: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell said that the earliest Adrian Peterson could be reinstated was April 15 and that it would hinge, in part, on his willingness to take part in counseling.
abstract: NFL suspends Minnesota Vikings running back Adrian Peterson for at least the remainder of 2014-15 season without pay; decision comes two weeks after Peterson pleaded no contest to excessively disciplining his 4-year-old child with a small tree branch.
lead_paragraph: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell said that the earliest Adrian Peterson could be reinstated was April 15 and that it would hinge, in part, on his willingness to take part in counseling.

headline.main: Goodell Bars Peterson for Rest of Season and Says He Could Miss Games in 2015
headline.print_headline: Goodell Bars Peterson for Rest of Season and Says He Could Miss Games in 2015
